creator: kmethe@inautix.com
text:
I'm using a configuration file to try and get log4j to write to a file.
I get the following error message when I run the program:

java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: java.beans.Introspector: method getBeanInfo
(Ljava/lang/Class;I)Ljava/beans/BeanInfo; not found

at org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppenderBeanInfo.<init>(Compiled Code)
at java.beans.Introspector.instantiate(Compiled Code)
at java.beans.Introspector.findInformant(Compiled Code)
at java.beans.Introspector.<init>(Compiled Code)
at java.beans.Introspector.getBeanInfo(Compiled Code)
at org.apache.log4j.config.PropertySetter.introspect(Compiled Code)
at org.apache.log4j.config.PropertySetter.getProperty(Compiled Code)
...etc...

This is what my configuration file looks like:
log4j.rootCategory=DEBUG, R
log4j.appender.R=org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender
log4j.appender.R.File=ftp.log
log4j.appender.R.MaxFileSize=100KB
log4j.appender.R.MaxBackupIndex=1
log4j.appender.R.layout=org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout
log4j.appender.R.layout.ConversionPattern=%d [%t] %-5p %c - %m%n

Kenneth,

This is a known problem with the RollingAppender when running under JDK 1.1.x. 
Please read the log4j FAQ. Thank you.
